item.title: Symptoms of Bad Code
item.description: 1. Rigidity Rigidity is the tendency of the system to be hard to change. Code that has dependencies that snake out in so many directions and you cannot make an isolated change without changing everything around it. Rigidity causes compile time error. 2. Fragility A system is fragile when a small change in one module causes other unrelated modules to misbehave. It is the tendency of the code to break in many places even when you make changes in one place.
